title: Rule of 72
guide:
# The Rule of 72: The Magic Doubling Trick

## 1. The Concept (ELI7)
Imagine you plant a magic money tree. You put **$100** in the ground (the bank).
Every year, the tree grows a little bit. You want to know: **"When will my tree have $200?"** (When will my money DOUBLE?).

You don't need a calculator or a computer. You just need the **Magic Number 72**.

**The Rules of the Game:**
1. Find the **Interest Rate** (How fast the tree grows). Let's say it is **8%**.
2. Take the Magic Number **72**.
3. Divide 72 by your number (8).
4. The answer is **9**.
 * *Result:* It takes **9 years** to double your money.

**The Simple Formula:**
**72 ÷ Interest Rate = Years to Double**

---

## 2. The Exhaustive Cheat Sheet (No Math Required)
Find your Interest Rate (The "%") on the left. The number on the right is how many years you must wait.

| Interest Rate (%) | Years to Double (Wait Time) | Math Check |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **1%** | **72.0 Years** | (72 ÷ 1) |
| **2%** | **36.0 Years** | (72 ÷ 2) |
| **3%** | **24.0 Years** | (72 ÷ 3) |
| **4%** | **18.0 Years** | (72 ÷ 4) |
| **5%** | **14.4 Years** | (72 ÷ 5) |
| **6%** | **12.0 Years** | (72 ÷ 6) |
| **7%** | **10.3 Years** | (72 ÷ 7) |
| **8%** | **9.0 Years** | (72 ÷ 8) |
| **9%** | **8.0 Years** | (72 ÷ 9) |
| **10%** | **7.2 Years** | (72 ÷ 10) |
| **11%** | **6.5 Years** | (72 ÷ 11) |
| **12%** | **6.0 Years** | (72 ÷ 12) |
| **13%** | **5.5 Years** | (72 ÷ 13) |
| **14%** | **5.1 Years** | (72 ÷ 14) |
| **15%** | **4.8 Years** | (72 ÷ 15) |
| **16%** | **4.5 Years** | (72 ÷ 16) |
| **17%** | **4.2 Years** | (72 ÷ 17) |
| **18%** | **4.0 Years** | (72 ÷ 18) |
| **19%** | **3.8 Years** | (72 ÷ 19) |
| **20%** | **3.6 Years** | (72 ÷ 20) |
| **24%** | **3.0 Years** | (72 ÷ 24) |
| **25%** | **2.9 Years** | (72 ÷ 25) |
| **36%** | **2.0 Years** | (72 ÷ 36) |
| **72%** | **1.0 Year** | (72 ÷ 72) |

---

## 3. Real World Example
You have **$500**.
Your grandmother gives you an investment account that grows at **6%** per year.
* **Question:** When will you have **$1,000**?
* **Action:** Take 72. Divide by 6.
* **Answer:** 72 ÷ 6 = **12**.
* In **12 years**, you will have $1,000.

---

## 4. Native Mnemonics (English)

### The Rhyme
"Divide **Seventy-Two** by the **Rate** given to you,
To see when your money turns into **Two**."

### The "R" Trick
**R**ate x **Y**ears = **72**
(If you know the Rate, you find the Years. If you know the Years you want to wait, you find the Rate you need!)

***
